author: EN
text:
I really dislike using VC because of the poor customer service and unreliability (I only receive my parcels 50% of the time when I shop with them), but for this particular item I had no choice as I couldn’t find it anywhere else. 

I typed in the correct address (and have proof on my order confirmation) but somehow they messed up the address and caused the delivery to fail. Now it is being sent back to the seller to inevitably be sold to someone else. When I explained to Customer Service that it should really be redelivered instead of cancelled (especially since this was the fault of VC not me), both customer service assistants” just repeated the same words again and again )in very poor English) and left the chat before I was finished chatting to them. Of all the customer service experiences I have had, this is the first time I have had customer service exit the chat because they just didn’t feel like helping. They said I had to sign up (at extra charge) to Premium and then I can see in advance when it goes on sale - but not even this guarantees I get my item. And this is an item I have paid for!

Tl;dr: If you shop with VC, there is only a small chance you will get your item.
title: Refused to deliver item that they made a mistake with

author: Amy Hawkyard
text:
I sold an item online, shipped it to the buyer and when I had not received my payment, I reached out to customer service to help solve this. They said that they had sent the payment and showed me the account details they sent the payment to which were not correct (granted this is my fault). I told the customer service rep that they were not correct and she said I had to reach out to my bank and it was for them to investigate. I did this and my bank then informed me of some information I needed to gather from the sending bank to allow them to investigate, so I reached back out to Vestiaire asking for this information. 

It has now been 5 days and I have not so much as received a response from Vestiaire providing the information my bank need to investigate the issue. I have sent numerous emails but I am not getting anywhere. 

This means I am without my boots AND without my money and the company are doing NOTHING to help. 

Their customer service has been awful.

author: Soph
text:
Terrible service!
I ordered a reformation top from Europe to HK, and I didn't do any research about what shipment service they will use. They use Chronopost. If you do a little bit of research, you would know how bad Chronopost's service is. My shipment didn't get any update after the first day it's dispatched, and I'm trying to contact customer service of VC or Chronopost. (Of course it's impossible to contact Chronopost customer service!)

I contacted VC customer service. Now they are asking for a photo id of mine and a handwritten statement, stating that I didn't receive the shipment. I had the following question:
1. I ordered my stuff from VC as an identity of VC customer, an identity as an email address, why when it goes to tracking my shipment, I have to provide my real identity behind this email address?
2. How will they handle my photo id and other data after they process my complaint?

Anyway, terrible service up until now, and if you google VC or go to Youtube, you will also see a lot of negative reviews. Avoid Vestiaire collective!

author: Dani
text:
Hi 
I am having a problem with VC. After it, I started to search for company info and read reviews from here. They have an ashamed reputation. If I had read it before, I would not require their services. My channel bag is LOST. 
I followed VC instructions to send my channel bag to France -  Office address. One of the instructions was to download a label, print and stick it on the parcel. 
But, I did not expect they would ask me to download a label that does not correspond with my info.  Yes, my name was on it, but when I called DHL to give updates, they said the tracking number that I have  (a number that was on the label given by VC) did not correspond with my details; it shows info from another country, another sender... How could it happen? Probably it was a mistake from VC that sent me the wrong label... They sold the bag, now they have cancelled it, and I still have no updates about my Chanel bag. 
If I do not receive it soon, I will go to court to sort that issue legally. 
My advice is to search or ask for more info about a company that you are dealing with, especially with a company that sells luxury items but did not offer the support that we all expected to have.
title: VC gave me the wrong label to print - the parcel is LOST

author: JS
text:
On opening the package, it was immediately clear that the Loro Piana cardigan - Ref # 17694453, passed by Vestiaire's quality control as compliant - had been shrunk. The texture was felt-like and the knit was very tight. A noticeable scent was also present. 

I spent at least 15 minutes on the Chat, took photos and filled in the online complaint form, all told at least 30 minutes. Never heard another thing until I got an email saying I'd received a refund. 

Although I received the refund, this is meaningless without acknowledgement of the time wasted or obviously insufficient quality control.

I'd like an email with explanations of:

1) how an obviously shrunk cashmere sweater passes inspection and is sent to the customer. 

2) Why no acknowledgement was made to the customer of their complaint, of their decision nor of what will be done in the future to prevent this happening again.

Vestiaire's attitude is always - always - cavalier and the only thing they ever do is apologise for the inconvenience. Despite their Chief Executive's ambitions, they'll never be world class until they start admitting their mistakes and being accountable to their customers.
title: Shrunken Quality Control
